reviewText: I love this game! I thank the creators of this Space Simulation game. If it were my choice I would give it a award (but obviously it is not). PlanetBase has to be my favorite of all time... It reminds me of the games I used to see all the time around my area ; and wish I could have them all :)  (But I couldn't) . Even though I am limited to watching streams after I bought this game (Due to a issue in my computer Graphics Card) , I still love to watch others enjoy it. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND to anyone who like Space or Simulation (And also Space Simulation Games :P ) games. This game still has flaws as it was released only about a Month ago or so (Earlier for some Streamers) . The updates in this game are coming fast fixing flaws (Of course after a while more flaws will come and go) .  PlanetBase is a Addicting , Fun , Adventure( In a way) , With Twisty turns . It has mile stones which gives you something to work toward (Besides being the best Colony around) , Its has Hotkeys that are very reasonably placed (Others might argue). Sometimes you can find out one of your most treasured workers might actually be a Terrorist (Intruder) or that on your rich visitor ships might actually be full of Terrorists (Intruders) . Certain streamers (which I will not name) have brought me to a liking of this game! This is my very large review of PlanetBase!

reviewText:
I have a fairly mised review, but mostly postive i would say.

The Good: Good graphics. This game is moderatly difficult. The game play is smoot for the most part. Though some things are pretty annoying. It's addictive to play.

The Bad: The AI is a little stupid. I saw 1 Colonist die due to lack of oxygen, because it didn't want to come in side the base. Lack of building varity.

My 3 biggest problems are more me nitpicking then anything. The UI is lacking to me. The Camera controls are very different from most Sim Style Games and there is no Windowed Mode.

Really in a few patches I think this game could be really great. So i would give it 7 out of 10.

reviewText: Whilst I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys the resource management genre of gammes it comes with a pretty big caveat. The AI is REALLY dumb. For example say you are building two items next to each other (a common occurance) an engineer will walk from the other side of your base to build one of them and then walk all the way back only to turn round and walk back again to construct the second item. Carrybots will walk past resources lying around outside your mine so they can get to the canteen so they can have a good stand around idle for ten mintues whilst another carry bot half a planet away will start it's journey to pick up the resources the other bot left lying around. It doesn't totally ruin the game as it is still playable and enjoyable as long as you have a lot of paitence with your second-rate colonisation teams!
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Happened to just come across this on YouTube and after looking at it a bit more I decided to get it. It is really well made. From the well done AIs, to the great design, and lots to do, it is really well put together. I know it is still somewhat early for the game with a few bugs but I hope it continues to expand and do even better. I would like to see longer term goals and many more structures and all sorts of things to work towards in-game to make it even more of a challenge. I thought it would be a breeze and that I would lose interest early on as I do with many games but to my surprise and enjoyment, you have to work at it to keep everyone alive. That was thrilling. I was pleased overall and hope it continues to be developed with new things to do. Thank you to the team that put it together. I have played lots of simulation type games but this one was different and actually had me sitting down and fully engaged more than all the others with a unique planet concept. Keep up the good work!

reviewText:
I think, it's a very good game! It looks nice and it is not easy at all: you have to be VERY careful what you do, ressources are not likely to come by (or to be produced) and you have to plan properly, what you do first in good order for a functional environment. It is about good sequencing, balance, settlement and micromanagement in logistics.

Some things could improve though but the devs seem to care in reading the feedbacks.

I am glad to have given it a chance :))

reviewText:
So far.

Solid and stable gameplay.

AI is okay, getting better with updates.

Replayablility is okay, landing areas when you first start off seem to be different every time.

Difficulty is moderately hard.

Building variety is good, but after you've built everything late game is slow and can be a bit boring.

Different planets appear to be reskins of one another with progressively harder starting settings.

Colonist variety is only four, don't look for deep interactions and gameplay.


Overall a very okay game. Fun but nothing legendary or groundbreaking. It's a fun colony sim for someone wanting to scratch the space sci fi itch. Also fun if you've seen the martian and want to play out a mars sim.

I recommend this game, barely, its fun for a single play through.

6/10

reviewText:
I don't think I can recommend this game at the price point of $20. Wait for a sale folks.

I can't say I did not enjoy aspects of the game. I would not have spent as much time with the game as I have if it were horrible. I feel it could have been better, or cheaper.

The game AI becomes frustrating as the game progresses. Ok, let me rephrase, the AI is an issue from the get go, but it becomes more apparent as your base gets bigger.  Here is an example. I have a base with 27 medics and 35 first aid supplies there is one colonist in sickbay with combat wounds who dies after 10 minutes of being left alone. Why don't I have the ability to make a sick bay a priority as I can with factories or biodomes.

Colonists have no sense of self preservation. They will walk into low O2 zones and walk by armed intruders like they are not there

So this is a future where space travel exisits and we can go to other planets and set up colonies, but we only have solar and wind power?

Camera controls could be better. The camera should rotate around a selected point, not the camera. We should be able to research new tech in the lab instead of buying it.

reviewText:
This is an amazing colony building game that fills a very niche category.  It's not triple A quality, as the colonists tend to act stupid sometimes, but it's still very enjoyable.

If you like space exploration, the thought of building a colony on a hostile world, and less micromanagement than Civilization, this is worth buying.

Want to be able to tell your Lemmings...er...colonists to go get that food they so desperately need?  Well, this might not be for you.  You don't have that level of fine-grained control that some other games offer.

It has its quirks but it's loads of fun.  And on Steam you can get a refund if you don't like the game anyway so why not try it?  Oh, this wasn't about not being able to buy it at all was it?  It was about whether it's worth your time to even try it out.

reviewText:

Apparently the updates really changed some things. My always growing food supply started to shrink. I attempted to counter manage. I have somehow failed. Base lost.
Wasn't too bad of a game. However, I believe I'm done wasting time with this one.

reviewText:
When I initially started playing this game, I became very frustrated as it is really a difficult game to master in the beginning even on the easiest difficulty.  One miscalculation and all of your hard work will be for nothing.  However, if you can get past this early point before you acheive self-sufficiency (which there is actually two levels of this; the first being basic where you can survive in the meantime and the second where you ensure your base will be truly self-sufficient).  It is important to monitor everything closely because things can go crazy real quick and this can lead to catastrohic failure for your colony.  Overall, this is an absolutely amazing game which I have already spent dozens of hours playing.  It is especially neat to see your small colony of only 7 people eventually turn into a burgeoning colony of hundreds of people plus robots and visitors.

If you are on the fence about this game, then just go ahead and buy it.  I am not saying it is perfect (as my below comments make clear), but it is still great fun and you will get tens of hours out of it, easy.

*FOR THE DEVELOPERS*: If you read this review, there are a couple of things I would like to say and I realize that you are of the belief that this game is finished.

First off, I really think you should reconsider being finished.  I would like to see some additional buildings to help with ensuring variety of gameplay which is important for replay.

I would also be interested in seeing the ability to build tunnels through rock formations.  That is defnitely something which can be annoying especially if you spawn in a bad place.

I would also reccomend that you improve the AI system.  As it stands, the AI seems very basic.  It tends to lack basic logic which is part of what makes the game so ridculously hard.  It would also be good if the people could actually interact with one another.  All of this would help enhance the realism of the game.

Finally, I would love to see greater variety of available planets.  And, I do not necessarily mean that the planets should be more difficult just different to mix up the scenery.  Maybe even have different gameplay options based off the selected planet.  An ocean world, perhaps?

FInally, I would like the ability to name my saves, the current save system is VERY tedious.

I know what I am asking is a fairly good amount but I think it would make the game that much better and so I hope that you opt to strive to make the game the best it can be and not settle for just good enough.

However, with all this being said, let me take the time to say what an amazing job you all did.  This is perhaps the best game of its kind I have ever played!  A very great effort indeed!

reviewText:
I recommend this game, but just barely. There are several things you need to know or put aside to like this game. First, it only allows for two of the most unreliable energy sources ever conceived (wind and solar). Don't know if they wanted to make a political statement, but from every playthrough I've seen, it's made the players curse the energy levels. No way humans would put their lives in the hand of such unreliable technology. Also, they have sandstorms. These would decimate wind turbines and solar panels alike. At least the amount of constant upkeep is in alignment with reality.

Second, the game can be buggy though it works well most of the time. I think the biggest annoyance is the AI will not prioritize things correctly. For example, it seems that no one will build spares (the things needed to upkeep the wind turbines and solar panels) if metal is needed anywhere else. Then, even if the material is available, it is almost impossible to get someone to build them.

And third, once you've built up every pod, the game is pretty much over. So there can be low replayability.

This game is for those that like building settlements and seeing how fast or how well you can lay out everything. And for that reason, I recommend this game for those that are into that. If you're not one of these people, you may find this game a big disappointment.

There are two other planets to unlock with different difficulties, mostly due to power generation again. So there is SOME replay value.

reviewText:
This a great indie game which has alot of scientific realism and a great future with customizable planets/climates possible.

Pros

-Good game balance:Unlike most colonisation sims,Planetbase isn't too harsh as long as expansion is moderate
-Great design:Every bio-dome is designed well
-Base-building system:I have had no problems with building connection corridors
-Scientfic realism:Taking in real aspects of science such as Vitromeat (Stem-cell meat) and Solar flares
-Modding future:This is the sort of indie game where modding could thrive

Cons

-Limited content:The game has only 3 planets so far and a limited set of buildings,it could expands similiar to Prison Architect or KSP

reviewText:
This game is well worth buying, I'm just not recommending it because I'd like to recommend some much-needed changes to the developers.

Please, when a component or a building placement tool is clicked in the wrong location, don't cancel the tool. It's too easy to click in the wrong spot by accident, and it sucks having to re-select the same building.

Please make the components for Labs, Cabins and Dorms snap to optimal placement locations. This would be save-game compatible, since components can still be anywhere in the building in the save file, but would be directed to optimal locations during placement. Sickbays, Control Centers have components of different sizes, so this might not work for them.

I'll edit this with additional suggestions later.

edits:

Please make the number keys 1-4 set speeds pause, 1, 2, and 4.

Please make cutscenes skippable. If i want a cinematic experience I'll go watch a movie.

Please ask for confirmation before deleting an under-construction building with resources on it. It's easy to do this accidentally, and it's a pain to wait for the resources to get moved to rebuild the structure.

Please consider allowing placing a building on top of resource blocks. Changing this would need more changes to the source code and is lower priority. Would need to add move resource blocks out of the way" task.

I'lll change this to recommend if 4 or more out of these 6 changes are made."

reviewText:
First of all, I would like to recommend the game, BUT NOT FOR 20 BUCKS.

The main part, the main idea of the game (build a base, keep up a balance between the raw materials, resources, workforce) is great.

But there are flaws... :

I missed the workforce management.
The AI does its job, but need to wait quite a lot to react (for example: to get the medic from one side of the base to the other, to heal injured fugitives or guards after an invader attack, resulting in dying people...). Not talking about guards... those guys spreads out on the whole base, except the area around the air locks... when a bigger group of invaders (6-8) enters the base, you can bet how it ends up... (Yes, they are armed, and yes there are planty guard posts, with safety monitors).

Should be good if one could be able to pin the location for the workforce. There is a priority button, but still, that doesnt solve the problem.

The idea to buy the tech upgrades is great, but there should be way more option, more tech, I think... There was a game back then, K240... HUGE amount of tech available for purchase. Some of them were crucial, others were more part of the personal game style.
There could be more tech connected to the buildings. The amount of buildings are quite limited. There should be way more possibility by buying tech: energy shield, automatic mining station, fusion power plant, additional recreational facilities, riot shielded guards, defense robots, etc, etc.

The resource system is too simple. There are only 2 raw material, everything is based on them.

Then the goals... There are milestones in each difficulty to reach. THE SAME MILESTONES IN EVERY DIFFICULTY!? Mehh...

There is no other goal than one: to complete the 10 milestones.
Then you get to the next difficulty level. Which is, as I mentioned, basically the same... one mission, on three different levels.
Within a couple of hours, you can beat the game.
The 3 level only differs in the conditions (more-less wind or sunlight, more-less radiation, etc).
If you manage to create a sustainable little colony, with patience you can increase the size pretty fast. Not exactly challanging.
So if you finished all the milestones once, you finished the game.

The graphics are good, nice atmosphere.
The music is a bit annoying, too short loops (I played many-many hours of Settlers, never realized the same problem there).

Overall, the game is quite ok, however there are a lot of possibilities within...

reviewText: This is a game about colonizing a planet. You land on an empty planet and are in charge of a small group of colonists with a small amount of supplies. You need to build a base that meets basic needs and an efficient power grid. From a small colony to a thriving base, you are faced with many threats. Meteoroids, dust storms, solar flares, power outages and even intruders that try to take over your base after it gains enough fame. While expanding you can contact people in the stars to come and trade or join your colony. If you want you can even allow visitors to use your bases services. As you expand you need to meet needs as they arise. The game has many achivements to work towards and unlock. This is a fun, strategic game that I recommend, although for its price it may be a bit too much.

reviewText: I love this game, its really addictive and i've enjoyed exploring it setting up a functioning base on the Mars like planet. The graphics are really lovely, trouble is this game is very similar to Banished, once you get things set up and running there is no mid or late game, no upgrades, no real tech trees, map size is limited and you can only have 1 base so you will get about 8 hours gameplay, get bored and move on. It feels like this has been released and should really be early access, it needs a lot more content and would really benifit from Steam Workshop content to open the game up more.\n\nIn short, great fun game but would i recommend this? At the moment, no.

reviewText:
Lots of depth, If you are a sucker for base builders. It took a bit to learn but once you get it is fun. It will beat the hell out of you this is not a walk in the park.

I plance this game in the same place in my head as banished. I enjoy both games however planet base to me seems like theres more too it. The planets have disasters and theres this neat thrill every time you turn on the yellow alert and shut off the main power grid and only leave on life support!
It is a great feeling surviving the disasters.

Its not a perfect game. However its a great bit of fun! (However with workshop support it would be the best game ever)

Thumbs up.

reviewText:
Planetbase is a survival building strategy game. Your quest is a manage a group of space settlers and build a colony on the new planet. For all that you should getting and crafting resources, and after that building. But not all so easy how sounds. You should also thinking what building are preferable at start and how big they should be, because at the start you have very limited resource and if you don't want kill all your people at start you should thinking strategic. In a game you have a lot different buildings what you need to build big colony. Game have 3 planets where you can play, all planets have another specifications. In your colony you should keep a balance in demography between workers, engineers, biologist, medics and guards. Also you can own 3 type of robots: caring, constructing and driller. You always should manage good your resources , you should have enough energy,water,oxygen and etc. A lot of thing depend of another. For example if you don't have a water, shortly your oxygen generator cant processing oxygen. And this not all, you also should survive a lot of impact for example meteors or intruders attack.

So my verdict

+have good gameplay what can be enjoyable for you and you don't see how fast time is go when you play
+good crafting system
+good trading system
+enough good graphic
+can bring enough challenge to you
+a lot of thing depend from another

-not a best camera mode
-i think they should put a more data what you can check about your base what more detaile
-AI sometimes bugy
-cant control peples invidualy

So i think this game is very good and if you like a building strategy games you shouldn't be disappointed if you buy it.Yes for now this game have some problem with AI sometimes, but this i think shortly developers resolve this, and if they also improve invidualy control and more statistic this game will be perfect! For the end i have a little advice for you, you really should do a tutorial at the start if you don't want fail in a few days in the start.

9/10

reviewText:
Ever wanted to build a base on a different planet? Ever thought about living on the mars. Then go and do it, at least in this game you can settle on Mars (and two other planets).

When I played the tutorial and first hours of the first planet which is titled as very simple I thought, oh no, this will get boring pretty soon. As soon as you have all building types you can watch your citizens do everything just fine.
I was close to deinstalling the game again but decided to play on. And suddenly, everything changed.

As soon as you build a landing platform, where trader, visitor and new colonists can land you can screw everything within seconds.
If you expand to fast, you will ran out of food. If you have to many visitors, you will ran out of food. If you buy other things with too much food, you ran out of food.
When I played this, as soon as someone is very hungry he stops working. Bad thing if that person is a biologist who grows food. But this has been fixed in the latest patch.

So far I only played on the lowest difficult planet and tried the next planet for a short time.

If you are a fan of city builder like Banished, SimCity or City Skylines and a fan of doing this not only on earth, I can recommend this game to you.
Maybe I will update this review when I played on the other 2 planets as well.


Disclaimer: I got a free key to test and review

reviewText: An excellent, fun game. The best colony game that I have ever played. I love the difficulty and ignore the reviewers with 60+ hours who say that it takes 30 minutes to master. You will fail, again and again. Any number of things can kill your base so watch those power levels, keep the spare parts in stock, and keep building those vegatable farms.

reviewText:
I am so torn, this game is really good has lots of good qaulity content. However once you get past mid game things begin to become redundant. Once you reach late game there becomes hardly anything left to do. Which is why I hope that add more things for late game. UI and gameplay mechanics are balanced and well polished. Good sound design. I really would like to see more content. I will recommend this because it is a very good game. It just doesn't quite have the replayability factor. PLEASE Devs add more late game content preferably FLC! Such good potential here, it needs some extra love!

30 Minutes or Less, I really hope they continue to add more content.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7oyUuz7Yxno&feature=youtu.be

Thanks so much for reading my review, Cap'n Kibs doesn't make a half bad colony after all!

reviewText: Best colony builder ive played yet. i definately recommend this game to anyone who is interested in city builders and colony builders. Especially if you liked take on mars. There are a couple bugs but nothing thats game breaking. Cant wait to see what the modding community comes up with for this game.\n\nEdit: Allright so, when it comes to the bugs, certain people end up not doing their job. Once you run out of a  certain material and you mix that with people not doing their job, you end up having to restart all over again cause youve essentially lost. Also, you cannot rotate the building the the direction that you want (personally i think thats garbage). This is a great a game all in all but im hoping the devs fix some of the issues and continue to add content or at least give modders the ability to add content.
